Key Arguments: The legislation is unpopular with the public and infringes on individual rights.
The bill is vaguely written, which could lead to future amendments that further restrict freedoms.
Current voluntary codes have already led to excessive censorship on social media platforms.
The proposal is seen as a significant imposition on free speech.
Exemptions for professional news media and educational institutions could lead to biased information dissemination.
The bill should apply equally to all entities, including government and media, or not at all.

Shining the light of inquiry into the darkness of an issue is the only way forward in a liberal democracy like Australia.
